avalancheActivity.comment:
Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in some places. Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach medium size in isolated cases.
In addition the avalanche prone wind slabs should be taken into account. They can at their margins be released, in particular by large loads and reach medium size.

This applies in particular in little used terrain along the border with France. In the other regions and on sunny slopes the avalanches are less common.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are rather rare but are difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The fresh snow and the wind slabs are lying on a crust below approximately 2300 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs of last week can be released, especially by large additional loads,, caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
In isolated cases the avalanches can be released in the faceted old snow and reach large size.

In little used terrain the situation is more precarious. Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in particular on steep north, northeast and east facing slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains.

tendency.highlights: The meteorological conditions will foster a gradual decrease in the danger of dry avalanches.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: In some localities a little new snow above approximately 1100 m: The avalanche danger will persist.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger.
Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released in very isolated cases.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: A little new snow above approximately 800 m: This snow and very particularly the wind slabs that are being formed by the northeasterly wind can be released in isolated cases above the tree line. The avalanche danger will increase but remain within the current danger level.
